subject: statistics
title: Sample Correlation
contentHtml:
When analyzing data, we often want to understand how two variables are related. Sample correlation measures the strength and direction of this relationship.

In essence, it answers: 'Is there a pattern between these two variables?' or 'Do they tend to move together?'
intuition: Think of it like this: Imagine you're trying to predict the height of someone based on their shoe size. If there's a strong positive correlation, people with larger shoe sizes tend to be taller.
realWorldApplications: In machine learning, understanding correlations between features is crucial for building accurate models.
commonMistakes: Don't confuse correlation with causation: just because two variables are related doesn't mean one causes the other.

subject: statistics
title: Sample Correlation
contentHtml:
In statistics, correlation measures the strength and direction of a linear relationship between two continuous variables. There are three primary types: Pearson's r, Spearman's rank correlation coefficient ρ, and Kendall's τ.

Pearson's r is the most widely used, assuming normally distributed data. It ranges from -1 (perfect negative correlation) to 1 (perfect positive correlation), with 0 indicating no correlation.
name: Pearson's Correlation Coefficient" },
intuition: Correlation reveals the degree to which two variables move together. A high positive correlation indicates a strong linear relationship, while a negative value suggests an inverse relationship.
realWorldApplications: In machine learning, correlation is used in feature selection and dimensionality reduction
